summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio, primarily dated between 2019 and 2020, alleging widespread financial corruption, securities fraud, and money laundering involving major financial firms (Apollo, Blackstone), their executives (Leon Black, Steve Schwarzman), and connections to Jeffrey Epstein, Jared Kushner, and the Trump administration. It accuses the SEC of being grossly corrupt and covering up these activities.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email chain, making extensive allegations of financial fraud, money laundering, and SEC corruption involving Apollo, Blackstone, Epstein, Kushner, and others. Presents himself as a whistleblower.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Repeatedly referred to as 'Fat Leon', a 'Milken degenerate', and alleged to be involved in money laundering, corrupt insurance industry takeovers, and connected to Jeffrey Epstein and Jared Kushner.

persons.name: Steve Schwarzman
persons.context: Labeled a 'degenerate', associated with Leon Black, Jeffrey Epstein, and alleged corrupt financial activities including the takeover of the insurance industry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Allegedly connected to Leon Black, Steve Schwarzman, and involved in financial fraud/money laundering schemes. Mentioned in context of Apollo's Environmental Solutions Worldwide filings.

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.role: Senior Advisor to President Trump, real estate developer
persons.context: Allegedly connected to Apollo (Leon Black, Joshua Harris) through loans and meetings. Implicated in money laundering schemes and abusive naked shorting.

persons.name: Joshua Harris
persons.context: Mentioned as an Apollo founding partner who met with Jared Kushner and was considered for a White House job. Associated with Leon Black.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Hosted a Trump fundraiser. His company, Foundations Health Solutions, settled False Claims Act allegations for $19.5 million. Implied to be part of money laundering shells.

persons.name: Steven Mnuchin
persons.context: Accused of being a 'Milken Degenerate' and bailing out high-yield junk bonds, related to Leon Black and Jefferies.

persons.name: Stephen Calk
persons.context: Charged with corruptly soliciting a presidential administration position in exchange for loans. Connected to Lorber, Elliman, and Trump.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Named in the press release regarding charges against Stephen Calk.

persons.name: Phillip Frost
persons.context: Charged by the SEC in a pump-and-dump scheme. Allegedly involved in money laundering with Alpha Capital.

persons.name: Martin Schlaff
persons.context: Described as a 'Bag Man', alleged to be involved in money laundering through Alpha Capital and connected to various schemes.

persons.name: Nathan Milikowsky
persons.context: Led the 'Save GrafTech' group. Cousin of Benjamin Netanyahu. Associated with GrafTech fraud allegations.

persons.name: George Economou
persons.context: Also known as Georgios Ekonomou. CEO of DryShips. Alleged to run money laundering shells connected to AQR, Marc Bistricer, and indirectly to Trump via attorney Andrew Ekonomou.

persons.name: Andrew Ekonomou
persons.context: Part of Trump's legal team for the Russia investigation. Implied connection to George Economou and Atlanta-based H&L Equities.

persons.name: Marc Bistricer
persons.context: Toronto-based, alleged to be 'investing' in George Economou's DryShips money laundering shell. Connected to Clipper Realty.

persons.name: Stephen Feinberg
persons.context: Chosen by Trump to lead an intelligence advisory panel. Labeled 'Scum of the Earth' and connected to Bawag/Refco and money laundering bank HSH.

persons.name: Stephanie Avakian
persons.context: Accused of 'home cooking' for allegedly dropping the Apollo investigation after Kushner met with Apollo's Joshua Harris.

persons.name: Howard Heiss
persons.context: Named alongside Stephanie Avakian in allegations of improper influence regarding the dropped Apollo investigation.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Mentioned as joining WilmerHale law firm. Context implies connection to the legal network surrounding the allegations.

persons.name: Vladimir Putin
persons.context: Allegedly connected to Leon Black/Apollo through a Russian investment fund.

connections.description: Alleged financial and social connections. Epstein's Financial Trust Company filed in an Apollo-related shell (Environmental Solutions Worldwide).
Alleged connection through Apollo loans to Kushner Companies and a meeting between Kushner and Apollo's Joshua Harris.
Both are leaders of major private equity firms (Apollo and Blackstone) and are jointly accused of corruptly taking over the insurance industry.
Alleged connection, though specifics in document are limited to being listed together.
Met to discuss a potential White House job for Harris, after which the SEC dropped its Apollo investigation, according to allegations.
Shared surname (Ekonomou) and implied connection, with Andrew being part of Trump's legal team.
Both implicated in money laundering schemes involving Alpha Capital Anstalt.
Calk allegedly sought a position in the Trump administration in exchange for loans.
Alleged connection through Apollo's backing of a Russian investment fund.

events.title: Dilorio Email on Insurance Takeover
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends email alleging Leon Black/Apollo and Steve Schwarzman/Blackstone's corrupt takeover of the insurance industry, facilitated by state regulators and conflicting with the Trump White House.

events.title: Forwarded Email on Apollo/Epstein/Kushner
events.description: Dilorio forwards earlier emails alleging connections between Apollo, Epstein, and Kushner, part of an ongoing correspondence.

events.title: Email on Healthcare Fraud and Judicial Appointment
events.description: Dilorio emails about healthcare fraud, references Brian Colleran settlement, and notes Chad Readier's appointment as a judge, calling White House criminality 'off the charts'.

events.title: NYT Article on Epstein's Finances
events.description: New York Times article is referenced questioning Jeffrey Epstein's wealth and financial wizardry, suggesting it was built with help from wealthy connections.

events.title: Email Alleging Russian Connections
events.description: Dilorio email explicitly links Leon Black/Apollo/Schwarzman to Trump, Kushner, Epstein, and Putin/Russia, citing a Reuters article about Apollo backing a Russian fund.

events.title: Apollo Loan to Kushner Companies
events.description: CNBC reports Apollo and Citigroup loaned millions to Kushner Companies. Context includes Kushner discussing a White House job for Apollo's Joshua Harris.

events.title: SEC Drops Apollo Probe
events.description: New York Post reports SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo a month after the firm gave a $180 million loan to Kushner's family business.

events.title: Apollo's $60+ Billion Inflows
events.description: Apollo Global Management reports over $60 billion in inflows for 2018, which Dilorio implies is connected to dropped investigation and Kushner dealings.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher Dilorio, alleges a massive web of financial corruption linking Apollo Global Management (Leon Black), Blackstone (Steve Schwarzman), Jeffrey Epstein, and Jared Kushner, with the SEC complicit in cover-ups.
A core allegation is that the SEC dropped its investigation into Apollo shortly after Apollo loaned $180 million to Kushner Companies and after Kushner met with Apollo's Joshua Harris.

Dilorio claims Environmental Solutions Worldwide (ESWW) was a money laundering shell where Jeffrey Epstein's Financial Trust Company filed documents, connecting Epstein directly to Apollo's financial activities.
The emails allege that private equity firms Apollo and Blackstone, with ties to Epstein, have been allowed to corruptly take over the US insurance/annuity industry, risking policyholders.

Numerous other individuals and entities are implicated in alleged pump-and-dump schemes, naked short selling, and money laundering, including Phillip Frost, Martin Schlaff, George Economou, and various shell companies.
